adjectives.description: disable (comparative more disable, superlative most disable)

verbs.description: disable (third-person singular simple present disables, present participle disabling, simple past and past participle disabled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To render unable; to take away an ability of, as by crippling.
(chiefly of a person) To impair the physical or mental abilities of; to cause a serious, permanent injury.
examples: Falling off the horse disabled him.

entries.meaning: (chiefly electronics, computing) To deactivate, to make inoperational (especially of a function of an electronic or mechanical device).
examples: The pilot had to disable the autopilot of his airplane.
